order_name: Synbranchiformes (inferred, based on relation to swamp eels)

vision.notes: Eyes are small and covered in thick skin, suggesting limited visual acuity. Presence is inferred, as they possess eyes.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely important for detecting prey and navigating in their environment, given their eel-like body plan and benthic lifestyle. No scales suggests a high sensitivity to touch.

chemoreception.notes: Likely plays a role in finding food in their freshwater habitat.
